sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  import { Link } from 'docz'

const layoutProps = {
  
};
export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"framer-controller"}}>{`Framer Controller`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`npm install framer-controller`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`👉
`}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://www.dropbox.com/s/28wn05t31g78gf7/ControllerExamples002.framerx?dl=0"}}>{`Click here`}</MDXTag>{`
to download an `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`example project`}</MDXTag>{` with demos for each controller.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"introduction"}}>{`Introduction`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`framer-controller`}</MDXTag>{` library provides tools for managing state in Framer X
overrides.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The library includes `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Controller`}</MDXTag>{`, a class that provides an interface for
setting the values of a Framer X `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Data`}</MDXTag>{` object. As in React classes, the
controller's `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`setState`}</MDXTag>{` method will merge the provided values into the
controller's state. Because the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Controller`}</MDXTag>{`'s state is stored in a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Data`}</MDXTag>{`
object, changing its state will refresh overrides with the new values.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Controlled state simplifies many things that would otherwise take plenty of
boilerplate. For example, `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Controller`}</MDXTag>{` now supports a simple `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`animate`}</MDXTag>{` method
that works with `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://animejs.com/"}}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="a">{`animejs`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`, animating props and setting
state automatically.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`While `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Controller`}</MDXTag>{` might already be a useful pattern, the class is really just a
starting point for building more task- and component-specific controllers. By
extending `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Controller`}</MDXTag>{`, a designer can create an interface of methods related to
a certain component or state management pattern.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The library comes with several such controllers:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/CounterController">CounterController</Link> - for incrementing and decrementing a value</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/IntervalController">IntervalController</Link> - for making state changes on an interval</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/SelectionController">SelectionController</Link> - for tracking a selected item or items</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/RelativeController">RelativeController</Link> -  for setting props relative to another state or set of prosp</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/IndexController">IndexController</Link> - for tracking and changing an order of items</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/FetchController">FetchController</Link> - for fetching data from a REST API</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/FormController">FormController</Link> - for managing form values, validation and state</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/PlacesController">PlacesController</Link> -  for fetching place predictions and details from Google Maps API</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The library also includes controllers for Framer X's `}<MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="p">{`Page`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="p">{`Scroll`}</MDXTag>{`
components.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/PageController">PageController</Link> -  for controlling a Framer X Page component</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/ScrollController">ScrollController</Link> -  for controlling a Framer X Scroll component</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"hooks"}}>{`Hooks`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`As of Framer X v24, overrides can also include`}</MDXTag>
<Link to="https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-intro.html">React hooks</Link>. Newer
versions of this library will replace the controllers above with more efficient
hooks-based controllers. As a preview, see:
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><Link to="/createPageControls">createPageControls</Link> - a set of controls for the Page component.</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"installation"}}>{`Installation`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`In your Framer X project's Project Folder, run
`}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`npm install framer-controller`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"usage"}}>{`Usage`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`In an Overrides file, import the desired controllers from
`}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`framer-controller`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Create an instance of your controller.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Assign its properties and methods to components using Overrides.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-jsx"}}>{`import { Override } from 'framer'
import Controller, { FetchController } from 'framer-controller'

const controller = new FetchController({
    url: 'https://randomuser.me/api/',
    parse: (data) => data.results[0],
})

export const ImageContainer: Override = () => ({
    background: controller.data && \`url(\${controller.data.picture.large})\`,
})

export const FetchButton: Override = () => ({
    onClick: controller.refresh,
})
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`See each controller's documentation for information on how to use the controller
and examples.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"extension"}}>{`Extension`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`For help creating your own controllers, see the `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"/BuildYOurOwn"}}>{`Build Your Own`}</MDXTag>{`
section.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Made with ✨by `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"http://twitter.com/steveruizok"}}>{`@steveruizok`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
